Michael Silverstein wrote:

> Some questions and observations about the framework
> ---------------------------------------------------
> Having spent some time digging into JUnit I have the following questions and
> comments:
>
> - The preferences file is read in more than one place:
>   - junit.runner.BaseTestRunner.readPreferences()
>   - junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.readExcludedPackages()
>   I could be wrong but it seems like this is redundant execution, especially
> since the preferences is kept in a static variable.
>

The BaseTestRunner.readPreferences() reads the "junit.properties" file.  The
TestCaseClassLoader.readExcludedPackages() reads the "excluded.properties" file.

I believe these files are handled independently to allow user's to share the
"excluded.properties" while enjoying their own personal properties in
"junit.properties".

Mike
